p: Beside Anaplasma, the closely related tick-borne Ehrlichia can also infect human and animals. The diseases can be induced by Ehrlichia chaffeensis and Ehrlichia ewingii (Monocytes Ehrlichiosis) in human or heartwater in cattle (by Ehrlichia ruminantium) (Allsopp 2015; Paddock and Childs 2003; Thomas et al. 2009). Other forms of ehrlichiosis can also be induced by other Ehrlichia species like Ehrlichia canis, Ehrlichia muris and Ehrlichia mineirensis. As a tick-borne pathogen, Ehrlichia species could be detected almost worldwide (Allsopp 2015).
